Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of fourteen lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, probably from the Theban Region
Bibliographic references: Biedenkopf-Ziehner 2000a / Koptische Ostraka I: Ostraka aus dem Britischen Museum in London (p.276-280, pl.39)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (82902) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/82902)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Robert Curzon, 14th Baron Zouche
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Robert Curzon, 14th Baron Zouche
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. II 36 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
